alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 5:37AM CDT until May 25 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Canadian, Cleveland, Kingfisher, Logan and Oklahoma. * WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 AM CDT, Periods of heavy rain will occur with showers and thunderstorms this morning. After heavy rainfall yesterday the additional rainfall this morning will result in flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oklahoma City, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, El Reno, Guthrie, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Piedmont, Harrah, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Jones, Nicoma Park and Langston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
